intro: Malcolmia malcolmioides, commonly known as the Malcolmioides moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, emitting a sweet fragrance. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and somewhat woody. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
